meanings.definition: A person employed to carry luggage and other loads.
meanings.sent1: The porters at the hotel helped guests with their suitcases.
meanings.sent2: The porters at the airport were busy moving bags from one place to another.
meanings.sent3: The porters decided to have a race to see who could carry the most bags in the shortest time.
meanings.sent4: The porters were like ants, swiftly moving the heavy loads with ease.
meanings.sent5: The image of the porters balancing multiple suitcases on their shoulders stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: A dark beer with a strong flavor.
meanings.sent1: I tried a new brand of porters at the brewery last night.
meanings.sent2: The pub had a special on porters, so I decided to give it a taste.
meanings.sent3: The friends joked that the porters were so strong, they could lift spirits as well as luggage.
meanings.sent4: The rich aroma of the porters filled the room, enticing everyone to take a sip.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the porters lingered on my tongue long after I finished the glass.

meanings.sent1: The cheese platter included a variety of porters for us to try.
meanings.sent2: I had never tasted porters cheese before, but it was surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent3: The porters cheese had a unique tangy flavor that made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent4: The creamy texture of the porters cheese melted in my mouth like butter.
meanings.sent5: The distinct smell of the porters cheese filled the room, making everyone curious to taste it.
